original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme …pe…
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme pe

analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

analyzed: gandhabba kāyike vaḥ bhikkhave deve desessāmi

analyzed: tam suṇātha
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave gandhabba kāyikāḥ devā
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is that meditation to be developed that is directly visible, immediate, inviting one to come and see, applicable, to be personally experienced by the wise?

original: Santi, bhikkhave, mūlagandhe adhivatthā devā.🔽Santi, bhikkhave, sāragandhe adhivatthā devā.🔽Santi, bhikkhave, pheggugandhe adhivatthā devā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave mūla gandhe adhivatthāḥ devā  santi bhikkhave sāragandhe adhivatthāḥ devā  santi bhikkhave pheggu gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: “There are, bhikkhus, deities living in the root of a tree.🔽There are deities living in the heartwood of a tree.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, tacagandhe adhivatthā devā.🔽Santi, bhikkhave, papaṭikagandhe adhivatthā devā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave tacagandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ  santi bhikkhave papaṭika gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: There are deities living in the foliage of a tree.🔽There are deities living in the trunk of a tree.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, pattagandhe adhivatthā devā.🔽Santi, bhikkhave, pupphagandhe adhivatthā devā.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave patta gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ  santi bhikkhave puppha gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: There are deities living in the branches of a tree.🔽There are deities living in the leaves of a tree.🔽There are deities living in flowers.

analyzed: santi bhikkhave phala gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: There are deities living in fruits.

analyzed: santi bhikkhave rasa gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: There are deities living in flavors.

analyzed: santi bhikkhave gandha gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ
translated: There are gods who have a divine sense of smell and enjoy divine scents.

analyzed: ime vuccanti bhikkhave gandhabba kāyikāḥ devā ti  paṭhama
translated: These are the gods who delight in creation.”🔽The first section for recitation on the devas is finished.

translated: The Connected Discourses with the Devaputtas,

analyzed: gandhabba vagga

analyzed: sucaritasutta
translated: Good deeds

analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna
translated: At Sāvatthī.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā gandhabbakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekaccaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā gandhabba kāyikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: “What, lord, is the cause, what is the reason, why, with the breakup of the body, after death, someone here reappears among the devas of the gandhabba class?”

original: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekacco kāyena sucaritaṁ carati, vācāya sucaritaṁ carati, manasā sucaritaṁ carati.
analyzed: idha bhikkhu ekaccaḥ kāyena su caritam carati vācāya su caritam carati manasā su caritam carati
translated: “Here, bhikkhu, someone abstains from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, and from false speech.

analyzed: tassa sutam hoti
translated: He has heard:

analyzed: gandhabba kāyikāḥ devāḥ dīgha āyukāḥ vaṇṇavantaḥ sukha bahulāḥ ati
translated: ‘The devas of the gandhabba class have a long life span, beauty, happiness, and last for a long time.’

analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: The thought occurs to him:

original: ‘aho vatāhaṁ kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā gandhabbakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjeyyan’ti.
analyzed: aho vata aham kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā gandhabba kāyikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjeyyanti
translated: ‘Oh, with the breakup of the body, after death, may I reappear among the devas of the gandhabba class!’

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā gandhabbakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā gandhabba kāyikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: On the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in companionship with the gandhabbas.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā gandhabbakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhu hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekaccaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā gandhabba kāyikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: This is the cause and reason why someone, on the dissolution of the body, after death, reappears in companionship with the gandhabbas.”

translated: “What is the cause, lord, what is the reason why someone, on the dissolution of the body, after death, reappears in companionship with the devas who dwell on root-odors?”

original: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekacco kāyena sucaritaṁ carati, vācāya sucaritaṁ carati, manasā sucaritaṁ carati.
analyzed: idha bhikkhu ekaccaḥ kāyena su caritam carati vācāya su caritam carati manasā su caritam carati
translated: “There is the case where someone practices good bodily conduct, practices good verbal conduct, practices good mental conduct.

analyzed: tassa sutam hoti

analyzed: mūla gandhe adhivatthāḥ devāḥ dīgha āyukāḥ vaṇṇavantaḥ sukha bahulāḥ
translated: ‘The devas who dwell on root-odors are long-lived, beautiful, & filled with pleasure.’

analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: The thought occurs to him:

original: ‘aho vatāhaṁ kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā mūlagandhe adhivatthānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjeyyan’ti.
analyzed: aho vata aham kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā mūla gandhe adhivatthānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjeyyanti
translated: ‘May I, when my body breaks up and my life has ended, be reborn in companionship with the gods who dwell in scents made from roots!’

analyzed: saḥ dātā mūla gandhāna
translated: He gives scents made from roots.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā mūlagandhe adhivatthānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.🔽Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhu, hetu …pe…
analyzed: saḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā mūla gandhe adhivatthānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati  ayam kho bhikkhu hetu pe
translated: When his body breaks up, after death, he’s reborn in companionship with the gods who dwell in scents made from roots.

original: yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā mūlagandhe adhivatthānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī”ti.
analyzed: yena midhekaccaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā mūla gandhe adhivatthānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: This is the cause, this is the reason, why some being, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in companionship with the gods who dwell in scents made from roots.”

translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why someone, on the dissolution of the body, after death, reappears in companionship with the devas who delight in creation.”

analyzed: dvādasasatima
translated: The twelfth.

original: (Evaṁ piṇḍakena ekasatañca dvādasa ca suttantā honti.)🔽Gandhabbavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: evam piṇḍakena eka satam ca dvādasa ca suttantāḥ honti  gandhabba vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ
translated: (Thus the suttas on the alms round come to a hundred and twelve.)

analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The first sub-chapter on the gandhabbas is finished.🔽The summary:

analyzed: suddhikañca  dātā hi apare dasa
translated: The pure good deeds,🔽the givers are ten others,

analyzed: dānūpa kārā satadhā  gandhabbe su pakāsitā ati
translated: the benefits of giving a hundredfold:🔽the gandhabbas have been well proclaimed.

analyzed: gandhabba kāyasa yuttam
translated: The gandhabbasamyutta is finished.
